logic.playerState

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.playerState.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class implements a players board containing cells with Tiles where the dominos can be layed on to.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Board.Direction
      Directions the board can be dragged to

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(int sizeX,
             int sizeY)
        Constructor setting bank dimensions
        Parameters:
        sizeX - x dimension of the board
        sizeY - y dimension of the board

      • Board

        public Board(java.lang.String input)
        Constructor setting a string as the board. Single chars represent the ordinal values of the SingleTiles in the individual cells. Used for testing. Empty String is not allowed (Assertion Error)
        Parameters:
        input - String representing the ordinal values of the individual board elements. -1 for an empty cell.

      • Board

        public Board(Board other)
        Copy constructor, used for deep copyWithoutSelection for generating the potential points on the board (DefaultAIPlayer)
        Parameters:
        other - board to copyWithoutSelection

      • isValidPos

        public boolean isValidPos(Pos pos)
        Checks if a given position is a valid position on the board.
        Parameters:
        pos - given position that will be checked.
        Returns:
        true if pos is on board and unequal null

      • fits

        public boolean fits(Domino domino)
        Checks if a domino with a given position fits on the board - gets all neighbors - checks if neighbors are valid (Same type)
        Parameters:
        domino - to check
        Returns:
        true if the domino fits at the given position on the board

      • lay

        public void lay(Domino domino)
        Lays a domino on the board, if position equals null or if domino doesn't fit at the given position it will not be layed / disposed
        Parameters:
        domino - domino to lay on the board

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Generates a string for this object
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string representation for this object

      • toFile

        public java.lang.String toFile(Player player,
                               Bank currRoundBank,
                               Bank nextRoundBank)
        Generates a String representation of the board to be presented in the file. Since the board already stores a players selected domino in its cells the moment a player selects the particular domino it is necessary to remove it before displaying it in a file.
        Parameters:
        player - player instance to which the board belongs, used as key for the selected domino in the bank
        currRoundBank - bank for the current round which is needed to remove the selected domino from the internal board representation. (This board does not equal the displayed board on the gui because every selected domino is already layed immediately after selection to avoid multiple dominos on one spot. )
        nextRoundBank - Since the selected domino can be on either one of the banks, both banks need to be passed in order to check both of them.
        Returns:
        a String representation used for the file in which the board does not contain any previous selected dominos who have not been explicitly put / layed on the board by the player.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Checks if a given objects holds the same data as the current instance (modified from ueb09)
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - object to be examined
        Returns:
        true if equals, false if not or if given obj is a null pointer

      • moveBoard

        public Board moveBoard(Board.Direction direction)
        Moves Board to desired position. Returns true if board movement was done successful.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction to move the board to
        Returns:
        new board reference (easier for other Bots to evaluate which dir to choose to score max. points)

      • findPos

        public Pos findPos(SingleTile tile)
        Returns the position of a given tile, null if board does not contain it. Mainly used to display Logger message when moving the board on the gui.
        Parameters:
        tile - tile to search the board for
        Returns:
        the position of a given tile, null if board does not contain it

      • canMoveBoardToDir

        public boolean canMoveBoardToDir(Board.Direction direction)
        Determines if it is possible for a player to move his board to the given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - direction to check the bound of the board for
        Returns:
        true if it is possible for the board to move to the given direction.
